intro: Cissus afzelii, commonly known as the African stonecrop, is a climbing plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Cissus afzelii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing along rocky surfaces or in shaded areas.
